alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie County; Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; Converse County Lower Elevations; East Laramie County; East Platte County; Goshen County; Laramie Valley; Niobrara County; North Laramie Range; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Freeze Watch issued October 05 at 2:30AM MDT until October 07 at 8:00AM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... ...FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the first Freeze Watch, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 31 degrees possible. For the second Freeze Watch, sub- freezing temperatures as low as 25 degrees possible. * WHERE...Portions of the panhandle of Nebraska and east central and southeast Wyoming. * WHEN...For the first Freeze Watch, from late tonight through Friday morning. For the second Freeze Watch, from late Friday night through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
